TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DataGridViewColumnDesignTimeVisibleAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Specifies whether a column type is visible in the designer. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, types derived from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn> appear in <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control-specific parts of the Visual Studio designer, but inherit a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignTimeVisibleAttribute> of <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignTimeVisibleAttribute.No> to prevent them from appearing in other parts of the designer. This is necessary because the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn> type implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent> interface, which normally makes an instance of the type appear in the designer.
Use this attribute to prevent a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn> type from appearing in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control-specific designer.
For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified value to initialize the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnDesignTimeVisibleAttribute.Visible%2A> property.
The default value, which is , indicating that the column is visible in the designer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This attribute instance has a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnDesignTimeVisibleAttribute.Visible%2A> property value of `true`.
